citeinfo.origin: Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources (Data creator)
citeinfo.title: MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN: Managed Lands in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources

citeinfo.othercit: This data set was provided to personnel of Indiana Geological and Water Survey (IGS) on December 28. 2007 by the Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources personnel. An updated data set was received on April 16, 2009, April 21, 2010, September 20, 2010, March 15, 2012, March 26, 2013, November 8, 2013, May 19, 2014, March 4, 2015, November 10, 2015, June 16, 2016, April 19, 2017, and February 12. 2018. The data was provided in an Esri shapefile format, and was named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP". This file was approved for public distribution by the Natural Heritage Data Center.

descript.abstract:
Managed_Lands_IDNR_IN is an Esri polygon shapefile that contains managed land areas in Indiana, provided by personnel of the Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources (INHDC-IDNR) as of February 12, 2018. Attributes include contact information for land managers, as well as whether the land is open to the general public or if access is restricted. For additional information regarding lands owned by federal agencies, local agencies, and non-profit organizations, as well as conservation easements, persons should contact the IDNR Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center (317-232-4052).
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by INHDC-IDNR for the source shapefile MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP:
"ManagedLands_DNR_INHD_IN is a subset of ManagedLandsAll_DNR_INHD_IN, excluding those areas that are listed as conservation easements or listed as closed.
"ManagedLandsAll_DNR is the Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center Managed Areas dataset. It includes natural and recreation areas which are owned or managed by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, federal agencies, local agencies, and non-profit organizations. It also includes private lands with Conservation Easements owned by IDNR.
"NATURAL AREAS THAT ARE NOT OWNED NOR MANAGED BY DNR ARE ADDED AS DATA IS AVAILABLE. IT IS BY NO MEANS A COMPLETE AND COMPREHENSIVE DATASET FOR ALL SUCH AREAS IN THE STATE.
"The Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center Managed Area Database is a digital, geospatial file containing information on Indiana's significant protected natural areas. All counties in the state are represented."
descript.purpose:
To provide the locations of lands owned or managed by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources as a GIS layer.
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by INHDC-IDNR for the source shapefile MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP:
"This file was created as a statewide inventory of significant natural areas"
descript.supplinf:
The following is excerpted from the metadata provided by INHDC-IDNR for the source shapefile MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP:
"The Indiana Natural Heritage Database and its derivatives,"..."are made available on an "as is" basis, without express or implied warranty of any sort, including specifically any implied warranties of fitness for particular purposes, warranties of merchantability, or warranties relating to the accuracy or completeness of the database. It is distributed in the form of digital printouts. Subsets of the data are regularly distributed to organizations and which the Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center has data use agreements. Efforts are made to keep the Indiana Department of Natural Resources lands up-to-date. Other organization owned lands are updated whenever information is made available to the Department, so should be verified by those organizations as to its accurateness and completeness."

dataqual.logic: For more information, contact Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, 317-232-4052.
dataqual.complete: All lands owned or managed by IDNR in Indiana are represented in this dataset with the exception of conservation easements owned by IDNR on private lands, closed sites, and sites or preserves of sensitive areas of notable vulnerability.

horizpa.horizpar: For more information, contact Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, 317-232-4052.

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources
citeinfo.title: MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources

procstep.procdesc: Original dataset created by digitizing from topographic maps in the early 1990s. 1,648 labeled polygons. Process was done by Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Irv Goldblatt.

Updates to original dataset: increase to 1,700 labeled polygons. Most additions were local parks with LWCF funds attached to them. Data from deed record maps (Div. of Engineering) were drawn on USGS Topologic maps and digitized adding to previously existing Managed Areas Database. Process was done by Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Jeff Ewick.
ArcInfo coverage converted to shapefile. Updated by the Division of Nature Preserves as new dedicated Nature Preserves were added.

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Natural Resources Division of Nature Preserves

procstep.procdesc: Polygons with duplicate attributes were merged. Several fields were deleted and new fields were added.

Updated polygons for property owned by the Division of Forestry: 1. man1296 manager = forestry and dedicated =y: 19 records = DedicatedForestry_man1296 2. erase from StateForests [man1296 = Deam Lake, Starve Hollow] = ForestLessSra 3. erase from man1296 Vallonia StateForests Jackson-Washington = newVallonia 4. erase from ForestLessSra DedicatedForestry_man1296 = ForestLessSra_Dedicated 5. delete from man1296 Vallonia, Clark, Selmier, Ferdinand, GS, JW, Martin, MM, OP, Salamonie River State Forest, Francis Slocum State Forest, Yellowwood, Wyandotte, HC 6. add to man1296 ForestLessSra_Dedicated, newVallonia 7. change managers for nature preserves 8. update attributes

Queries were used to create a subset of the dataset containing only those lands owned or managed by IDNR. This ensures that IDNR can guarantee the accuracy of the spatial data and attributes. Non-IDNR lands (federal, non-profit, etc.) may be accessed within the entire dataset by request from IDNR, Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, 317-232-4052.

BLA personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "IndianaDNR_ManagedLands.shp" on August 30, 2007. BLA personnel then saved the file as “MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.shp” and edited the existing metadata. The following empty or duplicate fields were removed - UNITACRE, SITECODE, DNR_CE.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_NP_STATEWIDE-GIS.SHP" on December 28, 2007. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata. The following empty or duplicate fields were removed: "UNITACRE," "SITECODE," and "DNR_CE."

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_NP_STATEWIDE-GIS.SHP" on April 16, 2009. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_100420.SHP" on April 21, 2010. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_100920.SHP" on September 20, 2010. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_120315.SHP" on March 15, 2012. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_130326.SHP" on March 26, 2013. IGS personnel then saved the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_131016.SHP" on November 08, 2013. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_140519.SHP" on May 19, 2014. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_150304.SHP" on March 4, 2015. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_151110.SHP" on November 10, 2015. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_160616.SHP" on June 16, 2016. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an ESRI shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_170419.SHP" on April 20, 2017. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

IGS personnel received an Esri shapefile from Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center named "MANAGEDLANDS_DNR_INHD_IN_180212.SHP" on February 13, 2018. IGS personnel then renamed the file as "MANAGED_LANDS_IDNR_IN.SHP" to conform to internaml naming conventions of the Indiana Geological and Water Survey and edited the existing metadata.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological and Water Survey be cited in any products generated from this data set. The following source citation should be included: [Managed_Lands_IDNR_IN.SHP: Managed Lands in Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile), 20180212].
Please also acknowledge the Indiana Natural Heritage Data Center, Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 20180212
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
The product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
